_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The meaning of each item in the riddle [: Ant-hill - the body made up of the four primary elements
Fuming by night - thinking and considering all night about what you did during the day
Flaming by day - the work you apply yourself to during the day by body, speech, and mind after thinking about it all night
Brahmin - the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha
Axe and block - the five kinds of sensual stimulation
Lump of meat - greed and relishing
Dragon - a mendicant who has ended the defilements
